name: MultipartRequest
comment:
A multipart/form-data request. Such a request has both string http/http.MultipartRequest.fields, which function as normal form fields, and (potentially streamed) binary http/http.MultipartRequest.files.

This request automatically sets the Content-Type header to multipart/form-data and the Content-Transfer-Encoding header to binary. These values will override any values set by the user.

var uri = Uri.parse("http://pub.dartlang.org/packages/create");
var request = new http.MultipartRequest("POST", url);
request.fields['user'] = 'nweiz@google.com';
request.files.add(new http.MultipartFile.fromFile(
    'package',
    new File('build/package.tar.gz'),
    contentType: new ContentType('application', 'x-tar'));
request.send().then((response) {
  if (response.statusCode == 200) print("Uploaded!");
});

fields.name: fields
fields.comment: The form fields to send for this request.

method.name: method
method.comment: The HTTP method of the request. Most commonly "GET" or "POST", less commonly "HEAD", "PUT", or "DELETE". Non-standard method names are also supported.

url.name: url
url.comment: The URL to which the request will be sent.

contentLength.name: contentLength
contentLength.comment: The total length of the request body, in bytes. This is calculated from http/http.MultipartRequest.fields and http/http.MultipartRequest.files and cannot be set manually.

files.name: files
files.comment: The list of files to upload for this request.

finalize.name: finalize
finalize.comment: Freezes all mutable fields and returns a single-subscription http/http.ByteStream that will emit the request body.

contentLength.name: contentLength
contentLength.comment: The size of the request body, in bytes. This defaults to -1, which indicates that the size of the request is not known in advance.

followRedirects.name: followRedirects
followRedirects.comment: Whether the client should follow redirects while resolving this request. Defaults to true.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides http/http.MultipartRequest.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

maxRedirects.name: maxRedirects
maxRedirects.comment: The maximum number of redirects to follow when http/http.MultipartRequest.followRedirects is true. If this number is exceeded the BaseResponse future will signal a RedirectException. Defaults to 5.

persistentConnection.name: persistentConnection
persistentConnection.comment: Whether a persistent connection should be maintained with the server. Defaults to true.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and http/http.MultipartRequest.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the http/http.MultipartRequest.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

finalize.name: finalize
finalize.comment:
Finalizes the HTTP request in preparation for it being sent. This freezes all mutable fields and returns a single-subscription http/http.ByteStream that emits the body of the request.

The base implementation of this returns null rather than a http/http.ByteStream; subclasses are responsible for creating the return value, which should be single-subscription to ensure that no data is dropped. They should also freeze any additional mutable fields they add that don't make sense to change after the request headers are sent.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
http/http.MultipartRequest.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to http/http.MultipartRequest.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If http/http.MultipartRequest.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of http/http.MultipartRequest.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

send.name: send
send.comment:
Sends this request.

This automatically initializes a new http/http.Client and closes that client once the request is complete. If you're planning on making multiple requests to the same server, you should use a single http/http.Client for all of those requests.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
